summary: This document outlines the terms of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust Two', detailing the roles and powers of the trustees, the distribution of trust property, and the rights of the grantor. It specifies the beneficiaries and the conditions under which the trust can be amended or revoked.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the grantor of the trust, establishing its terms and conditions.

persons.name: Jeffrey A. Schantz
persons.context: Jeffrey A. Schantz is named as one of the trustees responsible for managing the trust.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Darren Indyke is appointed as a successor trustee in the event that Jeffrey A. Schantz resigns.

persons.name: Kelly Bovino
persons.context: Kelly Bovino is named as a beneficiary who will receive 100% of the trust's remaining income and principal upon the death of the grantor.

connections.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the grantor who employs Jeffrey A. Schantz as a trustee to manage the trust.
Jeffrey A. Schantz can designate Darren Indyke as a successor trustee, indicating a professional relationship.
Jeffrey E. Epstein is the grantor of the trust, which designates Kelly Bovino as a beneficiary.

keyFacts: The trust agreement was executed on November 8, 2001.
Jeffrey E. Epstein retains the right to revoke or amend the trust during his lifetime.
Kelly Bovino is designated to receive 100% of the trust's remaining income and principal upon Epstein's death.
The trust allows for discretionary powers of the trustees regarding the management of trust property.
The trust is governed by the laws of the United States Virgin Islands.
